title.narrative: Stöd till finansiell inkludering i DRK 2017-2021
Support for Inclusive Financing in DRC 2017-2021

description.narrative:
Insatsen är ett stöd till projektet ACTIF (Action, Change and Transformation for Financial Inclusion) för finansiell inkludering i Demokratiska Republiken Kongo (DRK). Insatsen implementeras av UNDP och United National Capital Development Fund (UNCDF). Den administrativa förvaltaren av fonden är UNDP Multi-Partner Trust Fund Office (MPTF-O) i New York.
UNDP och UNCDF kommer att implementera insatsen tillsammans med lokala partners på mikro, meso och makronivå. (i) På makronivå samarbetar UNDP med DRKs Centralbank för att stärka kapaciteten hos nationella institutioner. (ii) På mesonivå stärks kapacitet hos tre organisationer; den finansiella integrationsfonden (FPM) samt två professionella partnerorganisationer för finansiella serviceaktörer, Association professionnelle des coopératives d’épargne et de crédit (Aprocec) och Association nationale des institutions de microfinance (Animef). (iii) På mikronivå kommer mikrofinansaktörer och spar- och kreditkooperativ som är registrerade hos DRKs Centralbank stärkas.
Projektet kommer stärka kapaciteten hos institutioner och aktörer inom den finansiella sektorn i DRK. Projektet riktar sig indirekt till personer eller grupper som idag har begränsad tillgång till finansiella tjänster. Projektet ska förbättra kapaciteten hos den finansiella sektorns aktörer för att diversifiera och anpassa tjänsterna för låginkomsttagare.
Insatsens övergripande mål: 1. Att stödja DRKs mikrofinansiella sektor och därmed bidra till ökad finansiell inkludering.
2. Att stärka kapaciteten hos den finansiella servicesektorn och med fokus på produkter och tjänster för låginkomsttagare.
3. Att öka tillgången till finansiella tjänster för sparande, kredit, medels-överföring och remittering och med fokus på låginkomsttagande kvinnor, ungdomar samt mikroentreprenörer i landsbygdsmiljöer.
Den totala budgeten för insatsen är 50 153 988 SEK (USD 5 735 375). Ambassaden kommer bidra med 40 895 174 SEK (USD 4 771 899) för att genomföra insatsen under perioden 2017-2021. Budgeten kommer även finansieras av UNDP med 3 170 900 SEK (USD 370 000) och UNCDF med 6 370 723 SEK (USD 743 375). Även Fin Mark Trust (en NGO) kommer stödja insatsen med ett ytterligare stöd, vilket kommer öronmärkas till remitteringskomponenten av insatsen.

The ACTIF (Action, Change and Transformation through Financial Inclusion) is a project support to the microfinance development in the DRC.
It is not a direct support to vulnerable groups and micro and small Congolese businesses. But it provides support to the institutions that are mostly involved in extending services to improve financial inclusion and are close to the vulnerable population.UNDP and UNCDF, will implement the intervention jointly with local actors at macro, meso and micro level.
UNDP is working and strengthening the capacities of these institutions at the macro level, through the Central Bank, at the meso level with the Financial Integration Fund (FPM) and the APROCE and ANIMEF professional associations. At the micro level, UNDP will only work with microfinance institutions and official from savings and credit cooperatives, particularly those in order with the Central Bank. It is up to these institutions to give microcredit to their target group.
The Administrative Officer of the Funds is the UNDP Multi-stakeholder Trust Fund Office (MPTF-O). The DRC UNDP office and UNCDF will be responsible for implementation.
The intervention aims at financial inclusion in the DRC through the following actions: (i) improving the legal and regulatory framework and institutional framework for a harmonious and secure development of the microfinance sector, (ii) capacity building and financial infrastructure development, including the structuring of the profession to support the sustainability of financial services accessible to many people as possible.(iii) Strengthening the capacity for the service providers to provide diversified financial products and services adapted to the low-income population.
The contribution has the following approaches: 1. Support the DRC's microfinancial sector and thereby contribute to increased financial inclusion. 2. Capacity-building for the financial service sector, focusing on products and services for low-income customers. 3. Increase access to savings, credit, transfers and remittance services, by focusing on low-income women, young people and micro entrepreneurs in rural areas.
The total budget for the intervention is SEK 50,153,988.00 (USD 5,735,880). The Swedish Embassy will contribute up to SEK 40,895,174 (USD 4,771,899.00) for the implementation of the intervention during the period 2017-2021. The rest of the budget will be financed by UNDP and UNCDF: UNDP 3,170,900 (US $ 370,000) and UNFPA 6,370,723 SEK ($ 743,375). others remaining will be supported by Fin Mark Trust, which is finalizing a financing injection that will be directly invested in the "Remittances" component of the DRC work stream, in accordance with the ACTIF project proposal and the UNCDF / Fin (MAP) implementation partner (Making Access Possible).

The intervention ACTIF aims to increase the financial inclusion in the DRC. This will contribute to the achievement of the UN Sustainable Development Goals in the DRC, particularly related to poverty alleviation, inclusive economic growth and the reduction of inequalities. The project also aims to assist in the achievement of the DRCs national poverty reduction goals. The intervention includes five results areas: Outcome 1: At the micro level, financial service providers are strengthened, enabling them to develop innovative methodologies tailored to the specific needs of women, men and young people, particularly among farming and homeowner households of micro, small sized enterprises. Outcome 2: At the meso level, the sustainability and management of institutions is improved, enabling them in particular to support microfinance institutions and saving and credit cooperatives. Outcome 3: Innovative methods for digital online payments and online transmission of funds are developed and adopted to consumer needs, through efforts in enhancing the usage of internal and cross-border remittances. Outcome 4: The policy framework and the regulatory and institutional framework for microfinance are strengthened and support is provided to the Ministry of Finance for the implementation of the DRC National Financial Inclusion Roadmap. Outcome 5: The acquisition, learning and sharing of knowledge attained when implementing the project. It should be noted that this phase should put more emphasis on the micro-and meso levels, whilst the macro level will be limited only to the supervision and control of service providers in the sector.

sector.narrative: Education/training in banking and financial services

tag.narrative: 1.4 - By 2030, ensure that all men and women, in particular the poor and the vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to basic services, ownership and control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources, appropriate new technology and financial services, including microfinance.

1.4 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla män och kvinnor, i synnerhet de fattiga och de utsatta, har lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, tillgång till grundläggande tjänster, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till arv, naturresurser, lämplig ny teknik och finansiella tjänster, inklusive mikrokrediter.

description.narrative: The DRC economic activity 2018 has been marked by economic growth, which has been established in particular by a growth rate of GDP in 2018 to 4.1% against 3.7% in 2017 with a rate of inflation of 7% against 54.7% in 2017. Growth mainly due to the recovery of mining production. Despite improved macroeconomic indicators, the majority of the population remains poor. The available data would indicate that 77% of the population would live on less than US $ 1.9 per day.Some initiatives are being taken at the country level as a contribution to improving the living conditions of the population living in poverty through microfinance. These include the National Roadmap for Financial Inclusion.In 2018, the ACTIF Project contributed, led by UNDP / UNCDF, contributed to the technical capacity building of 7 financial service providers and provided direct support to improve the information and management system and new products. of 4 Coopec (Cahi, Guigal, Bomoko, Inkisi).These 11 partner institutions totaled 92,787 new customers, an increase of 9.4% over 2017. As at September 31, 2018, these institutions had a total of 1,083,642 active clients, 43% of whom were women. Savings outstanding increased by 24.52%, from 404,602,741 million USD in 2017 to 503,838,207 million USD in 2018.The development of savings and credit products targeting young people reached 4095 young people at the end of 2018, an increase of 37% compared to 2017. These results demonstrate the added value of the Project in contributing to the priorities of the National Roadmap for Financial Inclusion by increasing access to formal financial services and building confidence in savings among men, women, youth and micro-entrepreneurs. entrepreneurs including in rural DRC.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
